message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.CC 

Reasoning: The paper deals with codes and error correction, which are topics commonly found in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Data Structures (cs.DS) sub-categories. The use of equations to define codes suggests a possible connection to the Distributed Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The study of upper and lower bounds on code size is a common topic in the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) sub-category. Finally, the problem of detecting errors may be related to the Signal Processing (cs.SI) sub-category.
